messages.message: Why is dogfood running 22.11.0 and instabase.com (http://instabase.com) running 22.11.1? (_About Instabase_)
Because only certified images are used for deployments to prod, and we only apply patch numbers to certified releases
yeah we haven't bump the version in master branch yet

actually let's hold on this for now, I recall we are having some issue with bumping version to a future release since sandbox provisioning was relying on it (it reads the version and try to find the certified based on that vaule, and it should really just query release-system for).
let's check with prodeng team to see if that is still the case
@Heymian so is 22.11.1 certified but 22.11.0 is not? I thought dogfood would always be running a newer version than instabase.com (http://instabase.com)?
Dogfood deployment doesn’t go thru certify process, it just deploy with the latest code from master branch, that 22.11.0 should have been 22.12.0
dogfood is whatever is the version on master, so just have to bump up the version before the next code cut to 22.12
dogfood doesn't do patch releases, that's a concept only applied to certified images
Thanks @shiqi didn’t realize it was a deployment error.
